title: Quiz 4: Change, IT & Quality Management
description: Assessment on Change Management, Health Information Systems, Quality Assurance, and Care Delivery Models.

questions.question: Order the steps of Kurt Lewin's Change Process.
questions.explanation: Lewin's model: Unfreeze the old behavior -> Move/Change to the new behavior -> Refreeze to make it permanent.
questions.hint: Think of an ice cube shape you want to change.

questions.question: Why do employees often resist change? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Threats to status or financial rewards
Fear that existing skills will become obsolete

questions.explanation: Resistance stems from fear, insecurity, loss of status, or obsolescence of skills. A desire to learn usually facilitates change.
questions.hint: What makes people uncomfortable about new things?

questions.question: Match the Nursing Care Delivery System to its description:

pairs.right: Total patient care by one nurse for one shift (Private duty)
Group working together under a team leader
24-hour responsibility for a patient throughout hospital stay

questions.explanation: Case = 1 shift total care; Functional = Tasks; Team = Group led by leader; Primary = 24hr accountability.
questions.hint: Primary implies 'primary responsibility' for the whole stay.

questions.question: Which type of Nursing Audit evaluates patient care while the patient is still hospitalized?
questions.explanation: Concurrent Audit (Open Chart) looks at care in progress. Retrospective looks at care after discharge.
questions.hint: 'Concurrent' means happening at the same time.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ is a specific set up established by authority as a rule for the measure of quantity or quality (a yardstick).
questions.explanation: A Standard is the yardstick against which care is measured.
questions.hint: It starts with 'S' and implies a level of quality.

questions.question: Which type of Quality Assurance criteria focuses on the resources, physical facilities, and policies (the setting)?
questions.explanation: Structure criteria relate to the environment/inputs. Process relates to what is done. Outcome relates to the results.
questions.hint: It relates to the 'structure' of the organization.

questions.question: Litigation refers to being taken to a court of law by a patient/client making a claim for damages due to negligence or malpractice.
questions.explanation: True. Litigation is the legal process of taking legal action.

questions.question: Review the scenario below. Which aspect of Quality Assurance is missing?

richContent.content: Scenario: A hospital has established clear standards for wound care. They conduct audits and find that infection rates are high. However, they do not analyze the data or implement any corrective training or policy changes.

questions.explanation: They set standards and measured performance (audits), but failed to take 'Corrective Action', which is crucial for Quality Assurance.
questions.hint: The cycle is incomplete because they didn't FIX the problem.

questions.question: What is the acronym for 'Health Managed Organization'?
questions.explanation: HMO stands for Health Managed Organization, a type of insurance-based health care organization.

questions.question: What is a 'Change Agent'?

options.text: A computer system for tracking changes
A person who fosters and facilitates change within an organization

questions.explanation: A change agent is an individual (internal or external) responsible for leading and facilitating the change process.
